title:Sooshi's Personal Rolls
description:Stolen from SpaceMonkey's Weapon Guide

// Bold Endings - Bold Endings (pve,god-pve)
//notes: Rare archetype and one of two added this season. The stats are quite good compared to the rest of the archetype, but kinda brutal compared to other hand cannons. The reload has to be addressed, especially since you’re going to be super tempted to take Headstone in column 1 over Rapid Hit. In general this should be a pretty cool weapon, especially this season, but we’ve had a similar gun in the game for awhile now (Something New) and it hasn’t really picked up a following, so after the season this may suffer a similar fate. tags:pve,god-pve
dimwishlist:item=496728945&perks=1840239774,3230963543,124408337,2848615171,1988485648

// Ded Gramarye IV - Ded Gramarye IV (pve)
//notes: Chain Reaction is unique here, but it probably isn’t “good” per se, just probably fun. With Discord active the ammo will be free so you can merrily explode all the mods in front you as much as you want. If you want a Surrounded arc lightweight shotgun you should pull for Xenoclast IV from Zavala instead of this. tags:pve

// Maahes HC4 - Maahes HC4 (pve)
//notes: Rare archetype and one of two added this season. The stats here are the worst across the board for the archetype and it is a random roll, so you’re going to have trouble shoring up its weaknesses without some luck. The good news is that there are very few good void primary weapons in the game, especially hand cannons, so this doesn’t have much competition. The main comparison is Word of Crota, so a lot of the value is going to be just straight up preference since these weapons are on the opposite side of the spectrum in terms of feel. tags:pve

// Perfect Paradox - Perfect Paradox (pve)
//notes: Good perks here, but a lack of an autoloading perk will cause this to suffer compared to similar, superior options. If rapid-fires receive a buff to be competitive for swap DPS it could be an option with Vorpal, but that is not the current state of the meta.
 tags:pve

// No Hesitation - No Hesitation (pve)
//notes: The first and only support-frame auto in the game. A very cool weapon that allows you to heal your allies and also be able to perform the role of a standard primary. The base stats of the gun are so high that it basically does not need help in any category, so we may as well boost range or just pump stats to the sky. In terms of perks it may seem like Physic and Circle of Life are both “duh” for a weapon that wants to heal your team - and that is probably true for any build that isn’t dedicated to healing already (basically any class with access to healing grenade) - however, the gun already heals allies as a base function, so you don’t need a perk in order to access that capability. In general, if a player is being actively healed and dies anyway there probably wasn’t any amount of healing you could have provided that would have saved them. That’s why my recommendation is actually skewed more toward making the gun at base more useful on its own and synergize with your build rather than overindexing into the healing aspect. Demo gives you more access to healing grenade which imo does a better job at being a healbot when you want to than Physic will. Incandescent is so powerful at base that it is really hard to not take it. Circle of Life may be more powerful in high-end content, but the jury is still out on that. This weapon is a 100% definite craft. tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=1801007332&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3523296417,4293542123,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=1801007332&perks=4090651448,3230963543,3523296417,2675184851,1988485648

// Breachlight - Breachlight (pve)
//notes: The return of an old favorite weapon for many people, but unfortunately it is pretty much a dud. The stats are very bad for the archetype and even though it can get Slice it doesn’t get anything worthwhile in column 2 to make this worth using over Mykel’s Reverence, if in fact a person was planning to use a primary strand sidearm. This is heavily disappointing. tags:pve

Obviously autoloader + incandescent is fantastic, but you could play an alternate style where you hard reload more often if you were on double special maining this weapon. tags:pve

// Embraced Identity - Embraced Identity (pve)
//notes: Very poor stat package across the board, and the worst PvE archetype starts this weapon off in a deep hole. However, there is one discovery that makes this gun somewhat unique -> High Ground works on The Witness, and this is one of the only weapons that can actually make use of that fact. For the most part that isn’t enough to make this usable, but it is at least an interesting niche.  tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=2821677368&perks=1840239774,1087426260,1523832109,2319119708,1988485648

// Origin Story - Origin Story (pve)
//notes: A pretty decent return for one of the very first D2Y1 weapons. As a utility option for some high-end content this can be completely serviceable interchangeably with a Shoot to Loot + Tremors Breakneck depending on your needs. The extra orbs from this roll are very tempting tbh. I’m impressed with this, the stats are middle of the road, but this is totally fine. tags:pve

// Someday - Someday (pvp)
//notes: Hail to the King! Absolute PvP powerhouse. This has superior stats in every category to Matador (and all other precision shotguns) while having the exact same god roll - and you can craft exactly the roll you want. This allows you to thread the needle with your stat setup to hit exactly 100 range with opening shot without needing to overindex into range. Tons of handling, just an absolute beast. The only thing you can knock it for is sharing a slot with Conditional Finality. For PvE there is one good use case using Recombination similar to Heritage, and this time without needing a precision hit - making this far more usable in general and high-end content. The downside is that it does not have an autoloading perk and manually reloading shotguns sucks. tags:pvp
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1482024992,3142289711,4071163871,47981717,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1482024992,3142289711,4071163871,1370847713,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1482024992,3142289711,494941759,47981717,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1482024992,3142289711,494941759,1370847713,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1300023272,3142289711,4071163871,47981717,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1300023272,3142289711,4071163871,1370847713,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1300023272,3142289711,494941759,47981717,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1300023272,3142289711,494941759,1370847713,1988485648


// Someday - Someday (pve)
//notes: Hail to the King! Absolute PvP powerhouse. This has superior stats in every category to Matador (and all other precision shotguns) while having the exact same god roll - and you can craft exactly the roll you want. This allows you to thread the needle with your stat setup to hit exactly 100 range with opening shot without needing to overindex into range. Tons of handling, just an absolute beast. The only thing you can knock it for is sharing a slot with Conditional Finality. For PvE there is one good use case using Recombination similar to Heritage, and this time without needing a precision hit - making this far more usable in general and high-end content. The downside is that it does not have an autoloading perk and manually reloading shotguns sucks. tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1300023272,791862061,4071163871,469285294,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1300023272,791862061,4071163871,3335686050,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1300023272,791862061,494941759,469285294,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3232203524&perks=1300023272,791862061,494941759,3335686050,1988485648


// Pro Memoria - Pro Memoria (pve)
//notes: A new archetype, and the only one of its kind. This is also by far the best strand machine gun in the game currently - that doesn’t necessarily mean it is great though. The gun feels fun to use and is worth taking for a spin, but the use case of bait & switch on Song of Ir Yut sorta proved out that it is just not worth using over commemoration or unwavering duty unless you really want to match an element for a surge or a build.
 tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=3605603507&perks=839105230,1087426260,1523832109,3078487919,1988485648


// Suspectum-4fr - Suspectum-4fr (pve)

// Axial Lacuna - Axial Lacuna (pve)
//notes: Stats here are middle of the pack, and the archetype is one of the weaker ones for PvE. The gun can get a very good perk pairing for PvE, but it is basically almost identical to the Techeun Force roll and that doesn’t really see much play. As far as solar fusions go this may be on par with a Vorpal Cartesian for DPS/bursting and/or a Reservoir Burst Royal Execution for general play. It fits in snugly between both of those and maye ultimately carve out a niche, but for the most part solar fusions just don’t really see play in the current meta. tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=3867373351&perks=1840239774,2680121939,1523832109,2594592626,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3867373351&perks=839105230,2680121939,1523832109,2594592626,1988485648


// The Call - The Call (pve)
//notes: This archetype is so busted it doesn’t even matter what the stats or perks are tbh. ANY roll of these weapons is great, and if you get good perks and stats then it’s just gravy. In terms of perks you want a healthy balance of reload and blast radius, with velocity being a decent fill-in. That being said, this is one of the most “dealer’s choice” (pun very much intended) of all the rocket-sidearms since there is no definite best perk here in either column, and it can largely just come down to user preference. Slice or Lead from Gold are going to be the general consensus perks for high-end content, and Subsistence working for players who are using it in more general play or are going double special in high-end content using this gun for add clear. Demolitionist + Adrenaline Junkie is also on the gun in the perk 1 slot if that is more your speed. The two main column 2 perks I’d recommend are either Vorpal or One for All depending on your playstyle. If you want to just whip the gun out and hammer down a mini-boss/ultra/champ with it as fast as possible then definitely go with Vorpal. If you want to main the weapon and use it more generally for add clear then One for All would be more suitable for that. tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=3947966653&perks=1478423395,3230963543,1820235745,4049631843,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=3947966653&perks=1478423395,3230963543,1820235745,1546637391,1988485648

// Yarovit MG4 - Yarovit MG4 (pve)
//notes: SMGs are in a pretty poor state at the moment, so this is an awkward time for this to be added to the sandbox. The stats on this are HORRIBLE with a capital H along with all the other letters. The one saving grace here is that it does actually get Surrounded + Enlightened Action or Rewind Rounds, which should make this the best stasis SMG in the game - for whatever that is worth. The range stat is so very bad here, make sure you address it. tags:pve

// False Idols - False Idols (pve)
//notes: This archetype is still very weird, since you almost never want to use the heavy attack (especially never on DPS phases) but that doesn’t mean it is bad. This is probably the best solar sword in the game, but in a strict head-to-head with Falling Guillotine this loses horribly since it lack a 2nd dps perk. That being said it can get some cool column 1 perks that will help with general content. This is worth a craft for use during solar surge days on the Herald encounter in the raid. Also worth noting is that Swordmaster’s Guard is usually the go-to for swords since it is the only guard that boosts charge rate - however, on vortex frame swords you never use the heavy so you don’t need charge rate, so you may as well tank charge rate in exchange for extra defensive capability.
 tags:pve
dimwishlist:item=4207120603&perks=3666208348,2349202967,4293542123,3078487919,1988485648
dimwishlist:item=4207120603&perks=3666208348,2349202967,4293542123,3708227201,1988485648

dimwishlist:item=4207120603&perks=3666208348,2349202967,243981275,3708227201,1988485648
